text: that, you are well cooked.

speaker: POSTHUMUS
text: So, if I prove a good repast to the spectators,

speaker: POSTHUMUS
text: the dish pays the shot.

speaker: JAILER
text: A heavy reckoning for you, sir. But the comfort

speaker: JAILER
text: is, you shall be called to no more payments, fear

speaker: JAILER
text: no more tavern bills, which are often the sadness

speaker: JAILER
text: of parting as the procuring of mirth. You come in

speaker: JAILER
text: faint for want of meat, depart reeling with too

speaker: JAILER
text: much drink; sorry that you have paid too much,

speaker: JAILER
text: and sorry that you are paid too much; purse and

speaker: JAILER
text: brain both empty; the brain the heavier for being

speaker: JAILER
text: too light; the purse too light, being drawn of heaviness.

speaker: JAILER
text: O, of this contradiction you shall now be

speaker: JAILER
text: quit. O, the charity of a penny cord! It sums up

speaker: JAILER
text: thousands in a trice. You have no true debitor and

speaker: JAILER
text: creditor but it; of what’s past, is, and to come, the

speaker: JAILER
text: discharge. Your neck, sir, is pen, book, and counters;

speaker: JAILER
text: so the acquittance follows.

speaker: POSTHUMUS
text: I am merrier to die than thou art to live.

speaker: JAILER
text: Indeed, sir, he that sleeps feels not the

speaker: JAILER
text: toothache. But a man that were to sleep your

speaker: JAILER
text: sleep, and a hangman to help him to bed, I think

speaker: JAILER
text: he would change places with his officer; for, look

speaker: JAILER
text: you, sir, you know not which way you shall go.

speaker: POSTHUMUS
text: Yes, indeed do I, fellow.

speaker: JAILER
text: Your Death has eyes in ’s head, then. I have not

speaker: JAILER
text: seen him so pictured. You must either be directed

speaker: JAILER
text: by some that take upon them to know, or to take

speaker: JAILER
text: upon yourself that which I am sure you do not

speaker: JAILER
text: know, or jump the after-inquiry on your own peril.

speaker: JAILER
text: And how you shall speed in your journey’s end, I

speaker: JAILER
text: think you’ll never return to tell one.

speaker: POSTHUMUS
text: I tell thee, fellow, there are none want

speaker: POSTHUMUS
text: eyes to direct them the way I am going but such as

speaker: POSTHUMUS
text: wink and will not use them.

speaker: JAILER
text: What an infinite mock is this, that a man

speaker: JAILER
text: should have the best use of eyes to see the way of

speaker: JAILER
text: blindness! I am sure hanging’s the way of winking.

speaker: MESSENGER
text: Knock off his manacles; bring your prisoner

speaker: MESSENGER
text: to the King.

speaker: POSTHUMUS
text: Thou bring’st good news. I am called to be

speaker: POSTHUMUS
text: made free.

speaker: JAILER
text: I’ll be hanged then.

speaker: POSTHUMUS
text: Thou shalt be then freer than a jailer. No

speaker: POSTHUMUS
text: bolts for the dead.

speaker: JAILER
text: Unless a man would marry a gallows and beget

speaker: JAILER
text: young gibbets, I never saw one so prone. Yet, on my

speaker: JAILER
text: conscience, there are verier knaves desire to live,

speaker: JAILER
text: for all he be a Roman; and there be some of them

speaker: JAILER
text: too that die against their wills. So should I, if I

speaker: JAILER
text: were one. I would we were all of one mind, and

speaker: JAILER
text: one mind good. O, there were desolation of jailers

speaker: JAILER
text: and gallowses! I speak against my present profit,

speaker: JAILER
text: but my wish hath a preferment in ’t.
